domain_prompt:
You are a planning agent in a simplified manufacturing line.

Parts & state:
- Parts: p1, p2, p3, ... (individual items to be processed).
- Each part can be in one of four processing states: RAW, CUT, DRILLED, PAINTED.
- Parts may start already partially processed (for example already CUT or DRILLED).
- Some parts may not be mentioned in the goal at all; those parts do not need any processing.

Machines & capabilities:
- Machines: cutter1, cutter2, cutterA, drill1, drill2, combo1, paintbooth1, paintbooth2, ...
- Each machine is always AVAILABLE in these scenarios (no scheduling or time).
- Capabilities:
  - Cutting machines can CUT parts.
  - Drilling machines can DRILL parts.
  - Painting machines (paint booths) can PAINT parts.
  - Some machines (for example combo1) can perform multiple operations (e.g., both CUT and DRILL).

Legal actions (use these exact action names):
1) cut-part P M — Preconditions (informal): P is RAW; M is AVAILABLE and can CUT. Effects: P becomes CUT (no longer RAW).
2) drill-part P M — Preconditions: P is already CUT; M is AVAILABLE and can DRILL. Effects: P becomes DRILLED.
3) paint-part P M — Preconditions: P is already DRILLED; M is AVAILABLE and can PAINT. Effects: P becomes PAINTED.

Invariants:
- A part cannot skip steps: it must be CUT before it can be DRILLED, and DRILLED before it can be PAINTED.
- Actions never undo progress (a PAINTED part stays PAINTED unless stated otherwise).

YOUR JOB: Given an initial description of which parts exist, how far each has been processed, what machines exist and what they can do, and a goal description of which parts must reach which processing states, return a valid sequence of actions that achieves the goal.

OUTPUT REQUIREMENTS (IMPORTANT): Return ONLY a fenced code block containing one PDDL-style action per line, using exactly these names: (cut-part P M), (drill-part P M), (paint-part P M). Use exactly the part and machine names provided (for example p1, cutter1, drill1, paintbooth1). No numbering, no extra commentary. Example format:
```
(cut-part p1 cutter1)
(drill-part p1 drill1)
(paint-part p1 paintbooth1)
```

problems.prompt:
Manufacturing scenario 1 (easy):

Parts:
- p1 starts RAW.

Machines (all available):
- cutter1: can CUT.
- drill1: can DRILL.
- paintbooth1: can PAINT.

Goal:
- p1 must be fully finished: PAINTED (which implies it has been CUT and DRILLED in the correct order).

OUTPUT: Only a fenced code block with one action per line using (cut-part P M), (drill-part P M), (paint-part P M); use exactly the names p1, cutter1, drill1, paintbooth1; no extra text.

Manufacturing scenario 2 (easy):

Parts:
- p1 starts RAW.
- p2 starts RAW.

Machines (all available):
- cutter1: can CUT.
- drill1: can DRILL.
- paintbooth1: can PAINT.

Goal:
- p1 must be fully finished: PAINTED.
- p2 must be fully finished: PAINTED.

OUTPUT: Only a fenced code block with one action per line using (cut-part P M), (drill-part P M), (paint-part P M); use exactly the names p1, p2, cutter1, drill1, paintbooth1; no extra text.

Manufacturing scenario 3 (easy):

Parts:
- p1 starts RAW.
- p2 starts RAW.
- p3 starts RAW.

Machines (all available):
- cutter1: can CUT.
- drill1: can DRILL.
- paintbooth1: can PAINT.

Goal:
- p1 must be fully finished: PAINTED.
- p2 must be DRILLED (it must be CUT then DRILLED; no need to paint).
- p3 must be CUT only.

OUTPUT: Only a fenced code block with one action per line using (cut-part P M), (drill-part P M), (paint-part P M); use exactly the names p1, p2, p3, cutter1, drill1, paintbooth1; no extra text.

Manufacturing scenario 4 (medium):

Parts:
- p1 starts RAW.
- p2 starts RAW.
- p3 starts RAW.
- p4 starts RAW.

Machines (all available):
- cutter1 and cutter2: both can CUT.
- drill1: can DRILL.
- paintbooth1: can PAINT.

Goal:
- p1 must be fully finished: PAINTED.
- p2 must be fully finished: PAINTED.
- p3 must be DRILLED (must be CUT then DRILLED).
- p4 must be CUT only.

OUTPUT: Only a fenced code block with one action per line using (cut-part P M), (drill-part P M), (paint-part P M); use exactly the names p1, p2, p3, p4, cutter1, cutter2, drill1, paintbooth1; no extra text.

Manufacturing scenario 5 (medium):

Parts (initial processing state):
- p1 is RAW.
- p2 is RAW.
- p3 is already CUT.
- p4 is already CUT and DRILLED.

Machines (all available):
- cutter1: can CUT.
- drill1: can DRILL.
- paintbooth1: can PAINT.

Goal:
- p1 must be fully finished: PAINTED.
- p2 must be DRILLED (CUT then DRILLED; no need to paint).
- p3 must be PAINTED (it is already CUT, so it still needs DRILL then PAINT).
- p4 must be PAINTED (it is already CUT and DRILLED, so only PAINT is needed).

OUTPUT: Only a fenced code block with one action per line using (cut-part P M), (drill-part P M), (paint-part P M); use exactly the names p1, p2, p3, p4, cutter1, drill1, paintbooth1; no extra text.

Manufacturing scenario 6 (medium):

Parts:
- p1, p2, p3, p4, and p5 all start RAW.

Machines (all available):
- cutterA: can CUT.
- combo1: can both CUT and DRILL.
- paintbooth1: can PAINT.

Goal:
- p1 must be fully finished: PAINTED.
- p2 must be fully finished: PAINTED.
- p3 must be DRILLED (CUT then DRILLED).
- p4 must be CUT only.
- p5 has no requirements and can be ignored.

OUTPUT: Only a fenced code block with one action per line using (cut-part P M), (drill-part P M), (paint-part P M); use exactly the names p1, p2, p3, p4, p5, cutterA, combo1, paintbooth1; no extra text.

Manufacturing scenario 7 (medium):

Parts (initial processing state):
- p1 is RAW.
- p2 is already CUT.
- p3 is already CUT and DRILLED.
- p4 is RAW.
- p5 is already CUT.

Machines (all available):
- cutter1: can CUT.
- drill1 and drill2: can DRILL.
- paintbooth1 and paintbooth2: can PAINT.

Goal:
- p1 must be fully finished: PAINTED.
- p2 must be PAINTED.
- p3 must be PAINTED (it is already CUT and DRILLED).
- p4 must be DRILLED (CUT then DRILL).
- p5 has no requirements.

OUTPUT: Only a fenced code block with one action per line using (cut-part P M), (drill-part P M), (paint-part P M); use exactly the names p1, p2, p3, p4, p5, cutter1, drill1, drill2, paintbooth1, paintbooth2; no extra text.

Manufacturing scenario 8 (hard):

Parts (initial processing state):
- p1 is RAW.
- p2 is already CUT.
- p3 is already CUT and DRILLED.
- p4 is RAW.
- p5 is RAW.
- p6 is RAW.

Machines (all available):
- cutter1 and cutter2: can CUT.
- drill1: can DRILL.
- combo1: can CUT and DRILL.
- paintbooth1: can PAINT.

Goal:
- p1 must be fully finished: PAINTED.
- p2 must be fully finished: PAINTED.
- p3 must be fully finished: PAINTED.
- p4 must be DRILLED (CUT then DRILL).
- p5 must be CUT only.
- p6 has no requirements.

OUTPUT: Only a fenced code block with one action per line using (cut-part P M), (drill-part P M), (paint-part P M); use exactly the names p1, p2, p3, p4, p5, p6, cutter1, cutter2, drill1, combo1, paintbooth1; no extra text.

Manufacturing scenario 9 (hard):

Parts (initial processing state):
- p1 is RAW.
- p2 is RAW.
- p3 is already CUT.
- p4 is already CUT and DRILLED.
- p5 is already fully finished: CUT, DRILLED, and PAINTED.
- p6 is RAW.
- p7 is already CUT.

Machines (all available):
- cutter1 and cutter2: can CUT.
- drill1 and drill2: can DRILL.
- paintbooth1 and paintbooth2: can PAINT.

Goal:
- p1 must be fully finished: PAINTED.
- p2 must be fully finished: PAINTED.
- p3 must be DRILLED (it is already CUT).
- p4 must be PAINTED.
- p6 must be DRILLED (CUT then DRILL).
- p5 and p7 have no requirements.

OUTPUT: Only a fenced code block with one action per line using (cut-part P M), (drill-part P M), (paint-part P M); use exactly the names p1, p2, p3, p4, p5, p6, p7, cutter1, cutter2, drill1, drill2, paintbooth1, paintbooth2; no extra text.

Manufacturing scenario 10 (hard):

Parts (initial processing state):
- p1 is RAW.
- p2 is RAW.
- p3 is already CUT.
- p4 is already CUT and DRILLED.
- p5 is already CUT and DRILLED.
- p6 is already fully finished: CUT, DRILLED, and PAINTED.
- p7 is RAW.
- p8 is already CUT.

Machines (all available):
- cutter1 and cutter2: can CUT.
- drill1 and drill2: can DRILL.
- combo1: can CUT and DRILL.
- paintbooth1 and paintbooth2: can PAINT.

Goal:
- p1 must be fully finished: PAINTED.
- p2 must be DRILLED (CUT then DRILL).
- p3 must be PAINTED.
- p4 must be PAINTED.
- p5 must be PAINTED.
- p7 must be CUT only.
- p6 and p8 have no requirements.

OUTPUT: Only a fenced code block with one action per line using (cut-part P M), (drill-part P M), (paint-part P M); use exactly the names p1, p2, p3, p4, p5, p6, p7, p8, cutter1, cutter2, drill1, drill2, combo1, paintbooth1, paintbooth2; no extra text.
